Overview ark-sage v0.1

This Java library implements the L1-regularized version of Sparse Additive GenerativE models of Text (SAGE).

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
edu.cmu.cs.ark.sage
Main class for implementation of SAGE.
edu.cmu.cs.ark.sage.apps
A collection of easy to use tools for common uses of SAGE.
edu.cmu.cs.ark.sage.effects
A collection of effects that can be used to represent the different sparse SAGE effects (eta vectors) generating the observed text/features.
edu.cmu.cs.ark.sage.features
Classes that are used to represent observable features of documents.
edu.cmu.cs.ark.yc.utils
Mathematical classes and implementations required for L1 optimization.
edu.cmu.cs.ark.yc.utils.types
A collection of custom types made by yc.

This Java library implements the L1-regularized version of Sparse Additive GenerativE models of Text (SAGE). It is an algorithm for learning sparse representations of text. Details of the algorithm is described in

Eisenstein, Jacob, Amr Ahmed, and Eric P. Xing. "Sparse additive generative models of text." In Proceedings of ICML. pp. 1041-1048. 2011. [PDF]
The idea behind the L1-regularized implementation of SAGE is briefly described in
Yanchuan Sim, Noah A. Smith, David A. Smith. "Discovering Factions in the Computational Linguistics Community." In Proceedings of the Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL 2012) Special Workshop on Rediscovering 50 Years of Discoveries. pp. 22-32. 2012. [PDF]

To immediately use SAGE on an existing corpus of text (with labels), refer to the documentation for SupervisedSAGE.

To use SAGE in your own model, refer to the documentation for SAGE.
